thread.title_full: Vikings Reportedly 'In The Mix' For CB Nickell Robey-Coleman | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3

title: Vikings Reportedly 'In The Mix' For CB Nickell Robey-Coleman | Vikings Blog | KFAN FM 100.3
text:
Alexander Shun | @alexpshun 
Digital Content Manager | KFAN.com 
Another defensive back has been thrown in the mix for the Minnesota Vikings to sign after the departure of nickel cornerback Captain Munnerlyn. 
Nickell Robey-Coleman, the former Buffalo Bills cornerback, is reportedly one of the players that the Vikings are considering to replace Munnerlyn, according to Chris Tomasson of the St. Paul Pioneer Press. Source says #Vikings one of four teams in mix to sign free-agent DB Nickell Robey-Coleman. Could be slot replacement for Captain Munnerlyn. â€” Chris Tomasson (@christomasson) March 13, 2017 
Robey-Coleman is entering his fifth season after spending the first four seasons of his career in Buffalo. Last season, the former Bills corner appeared in all 16 games - started three of them - and finished with 35 combined tackles, seven passes defensed, one forced fumble and two interceptions, one of which he took 41 yards for a touchdown.
